00900.name: CALSPHERE 1
00900.description: Calsphere 1 is a passive geodetic satellite used for precise measurements of Earth's gravitational field and for calibrating ground-based tracking systems.

00902.name: CALSPHERE 2
00902.description: Calsphere 2 is a passive geodetic satellite designed for Earth observation and gravitational field studies, part of the early satellite geodesy program.

01361.name: LCS 1
01361.description: Lincoln Calibration Sphere 1 (LCS 1) is a passive calibration satellite used for radar cross-section measurements and tracking system calibration.

01512.name: TEMPSAT 1
01512.description: Temperature Satellite 1 was designed to study atmospheric temperature variations and provide data for meteorological research.

01520.name: CALSPHERE 4A
01520.description: Calsphere 4A is part of the geodetic satellite series used for precise Earth measurements and gravitational field studies.

02826.name: OPS 5712 (P/L 160)
02826.description: OPS 5712 is a military surveillance satellite used for reconnaissance and intelligence gathering operations.

02866.name: LES-5
02866.description: Lincoln Experimental Satellite 5 (LES-5) was an experimental communications satellite designed to test advanced communication technologies.

02872.name: SURCAL 159
02872.description: SURCAL 159 is a surveillance calibration satellite used for radar tracking and calibration purposes.

02874.name: OPS 5712 (P/L 153)
02874.description: OPS 5712 P/L 153 is a military surveillance satellite part of the early reconnaissance satellite program.

02909.name: SURCAL 150B
02909.description: SURCAL 150B is a surveillance calibration satellite designed for radar cross-section measurements and tracking system validation.

05204.name: OPS 3811 (DSP 2)
05204.description: Defense Support Program satellite 2 (DSP 2) is an early warning satellite designed to detect missile launches and nuclear explosions.

05398.name: RIGIDSPHERE 2 (LCS 4)
05398.description: Rigidsphere 2, also known as LCS 4, is a passive calibration satellite used for radar tracking and geodetic measurements.

07530.name: OSCAR 7 (AO-7)
07530.description: OSCAR 7 (AO-7) is an amateur radio satellite that provides communication services for ham radio operators worldwide. Despite its age, it still operates intermittently.

07646.name: STARLETTE
07646.description: Starlette is a French geodetic satellite covered with laser retroreflectors, used for precise satellite laser ranging and geodetic measurements.

08820.name: LAGEOS 1
08820.description: LAGEOS 1 (Laser Geodynamics Satellite) is a passive satellite covered with retroreflectors, used for precise laser ranging to study Earth's rotation, polar motion, and crustal dynamics.

13086.name: OPS 8701 (DSP 10)
13086.description: Defense Support Program satellite 10 (DSP 10) is an early warning satellite designed to detect ballistic missile launches and nuclear detonations using infrared sensors.

14129.name: PHASE 3B (AO-10)
14129.description: AMSAT Phase 3B (AO-10) is an amateur radio satellite that provides communication services for ham radio operators worldwide. It operates in a highly elliptical orbit.

14781.name: UOSAT 2 (UO-11)
14781.description: UoSAT-2 (UO-11) is a microsatellite built by the University of Surrey for amateur radio communications and technology demonstration.

16908.name: AJISAI (EGS)
16908.description: AJISAI (Experimental Geodetic Satellite) is a Japanese passive geodetic satellite covered with mirrors for laser ranging experiments and precise orbit determination.

19548.name: TDRS 3
19548.description: TDRS-3 (Tracking and Data Relay Satellite) provides communication relay services for NASA missions, including the Space Shuttle and International Space Station.

19751.name: COSMOS 1989 (ETALON 1)
19751.description: ETALON 1 is a Soviet/Russian geodetic satellite covered with laser retroreflectors, used for precise satellite laser ranging and geodetic measurements.

20026.name: COSMOS 2024 (ETALON 2)
20026.description: ETALON 2 is a Soviet/Russian geodetic satellite, twin to ETALON 1, used for laser ranging and precise geodetic measurements.

20253.name: FLTSATCOM 8 (USA 46)
20253.description: FLTSATCOM 8 is a US Navy communications satellite providing secure communications for military operations worldwide.

20442.name: LUSAT (LO-19)
20442.description: LUSAT (LO-19) is an amateur radio satellite built by AMSAT for ham radio communications and educational purposes.

20580.name: HST
20580.description: The Hubble Space Telescope (HST) is a space telescope that has revolutionized astronomy by providing unprecedented deep-field views of the universe in visible, ultraviolet, and near-infrared light.

20776.name: SKYNET 4C
20776.description: SKYNET 4C is a British military communications satellite providing secure communications for UK armed forces worldwide.

20929.name: USA 65 (DSP 15)
20929.description: USA 65 (DSP 15) is a Defense Support Program satellite for early warning of ballistic missile launches and nuclear detonations.

21639.name: TDRS 5
21639.description: TDRS-5 is part of NASA's Tracking and Data Relay Satellite System, providing communication relay services for spacecraft and the International Space Station.

21805.name: USA 75 (DSP 16)
21805.description: USA 75 (DSP 16) is a Defense Support Program satellite designed for early warning of missile launches and space surveillance.

22195.name: LAGEOS 2
22195.description: LAGEOS 2 is a passive satellite covered with retroreflectors, used for precise laser ranging to study Earth's rotation, polar motion, and crustal dynamics. It's the twin of LAGEOS 1.

22314.name: TDRS 6
22314.description: TDRS-6 provides communication relay services for NASA missions, enabling continuous contact with spacecraft and astronauts.

22490.name: SCD 1
22490.description: SCD-1 (Satélite de Coleta de Dados 1) is a Brazilian environmental data collection satellite for monitoring weather and environmental conditions.

22787.name: UFO 2 (USA 95)
22787.description: UFO 2 (USA 95) is a classified US military satellite, likely used for signals intelligence and electronic surveillance.

22824.name: STELLA
22824.description: STELLA is a French geodetic satellite covered with laser retroreflectors, used for satellite laser ranging and atmospheric studies.

22825.name: EYESAT A (AO-27)
22825.description: EYESAT-A (AO-27) is an amateur radio satellite that provides communication services for ham radio operators and educational purposes.

22826.name: ITAMSAT (IO-26)
22826.description: ITAMSAT (IO-26) is an Italian amateur radio satellite built for ham radio communications and technology demonstration.

22988.name: USA 99 (MILSTAR-1 1)
22988.description: MILSTAR-1 1 is a US military strategic communications satellite providing secure, jam-resistant communications for military operations.

23439.name: RADIO ROSTO (RS-15)
23439.description: Radio ROSTO (RS-15) is a Russian amateur radio satellite providing communication services for ham radio operators.

23467.name: UFO 4 (USA 108)
23467.description: UFO 4 (USA 108) is a classified US military satellite, likely used for signals intelligence and electronic surveillance operations.

23613.name: TDRS 7
23613.description: TDRS-7 is part of NASA's communication relay satellite system, providing continuous contact with spacecraft and the International Space Station.

23712.name: USA 115 (MILSTAR-1 2)
23712.description: MILSTAR-1 2 is a US military strategic communications satellite providing secure, survivable communications for defense operations.

23802.name: POLAR
23802.description: POLAR is a NASA scientific satellite designed to study the polar regions of Earth's magnetosphere and aurora phenomena.

23839.name: INMARSAT 3-F1
23839.description: INMARSAT 3-F1 is a maritime and mobile communications satellite providing global satellite communications services.

23893.name: USA 119
23893.description: USA 119 is a classified US military satellite, likely used for reconnaissance and intelligence gathering operations.

24278.name: JAS-2 (FO-29)
24278.description: JAS-2 (FO-29) is a Japanese amateur radio satellite providing communication services for ham radio operators worldwide.

24307.name: INMARSAT 3-F2
24307.description: INMARSAT 3-F2 provides global mobile satellite communications services for maritime, aeronautical, and land mobile users.

24674.name: INMARSAT 3-F3
24674.description: INMARSAT 3-F3 is part of the global mobile satellite communications constellation serving users worldwide.

24876.name: NAVSTAR 43 (USA 132)
24876.description: NAVSTAR 43 is a GPS satellite (Block IIA) that provides global positioning, navigation, and timing services as part of the GPS constellation.

24920.name: FORTE
24920.description: FORTE (Fast On-orbit Recording of Transient Events) is a Los Alamos National Laboratory satellite designed to detect and analyze lightning and radio frequency emissions.

24936.name: AMC-3
24936.description: AMC-3 is a commercial communications satellite providing television broadcasting and telecommunications services across the Americas.

25019.name: USA 134
25019.description: USA 134 is a classified military satellite, likely part of the Defense Support Program (DSP) for early warning and missile detection.

25118.name: ORBCOMM FM06
25118.description: ORBCOMM FM06 is part of the ORBCOMM constellation providing low-Earth orbit satellite communications for messaging and data services.

25153.name: INMARSAT 3-F5
25153.description: INMARSAT 3-F5 provides global mobile satellite communications services for maritime, aeronautical, and land mobile applications.

25159.name: ORBCOMM FM04
25159.description: ORBCOMM FM04 is part of the ORBCOMM low-Earth orbit satellite constellation for messaging and data communications.

25160.name: CELESTIS-02 & TAURUS R/B
25160.description: CELESTIS-02 is a memorial spaceflight satellite carrying cremated remains, launched along with the Taurus rocket body.

25397.name: TECHSAT 1B (GO-32)
25397.description: TECHSAT 1B (GO-32) is an amateur radio satellite built by AMSAT for ham radio communications and educational purposes.

25398.name: WESTPAC
25398.description: WESTPAC is a microsatellite designed for technology demonstration and amateur radio communications.

25415.name: ORBCOMM FM19
25415.description: ORBCOMM FM19 is part of the ORBCOMM constellation providing global messaging and data communications services.

25416.name: ORBCOMM FM20
25416.description: ORBCOMM FM20 provides low-Earth orbit satellite communications for messaging and data services worldwide.

25481.name: ORBCOMM FM27
25481.description: ORBCOMM FM27 is part of the ORBCOMM satellite constellation for global messaging and data communications.

25504.name: SCD 2
25504.description: SCD-2 (Satélite de Coleta de Dados 2) is a Brazilian environmental data collection satellite for monitoring weather and environmental conditions.

25544.name: ISS (ZARYA)
25544.description: The International Space Station (ISS) is a habitable artificial satellite and research laboratory in low Earth orbit. It serves as a microgravity research laboratory where crew members conduct experiments in biology, physics, astronomy, and other fields.

25560.name: SWAS
25560.description: SWAS (Submillimeter Wave Astronomy Satellite) is a NASA space telescope designed to study star formation and interstellar chemistry through submillimeter observations.

25639.name: SKYNET 4E
25639.description: SKYNET 4E is a British military communications satellite providing secure communications for UK armed forces worldwide.

25757.name: DLR-TUBSAT
25757.description: DLR-TUBSAT is a German microsatellite built by the Technical University of Berlin for Earth observation and technology demonstration.

25867.name: CXO
25867.description: The Chandra X-ray Observatory (CXO) is NASA's flagship X-ray telescope, providing unprecedented high-resolution images of X-ray sources throughout the universe.

25924.name: ABS-6
25924.description: ABS-6 is a commercial communications satellite providing television broadcasting and telecommunications services across Asia and the Pacific.

25933.name: NAVSTAR 46 (USA 145)
25933.description: NAVSTAR 46 is a GPS satellite (Block IIR) providing enhanced global positioning, navigation, and timing services with improved accuracy and anti-jamming capabilities.

25967.name: UFO 10 (USA 146)
25967.description: UFO 10 (USA 146) is a classified US military satellite, likely used for signals intelligence and electronic surveillance operations.

25982.name: ORBCOMM FM32
25982.description: ORBCOMM FM32 is part of the ORBCOMM constellation providing global messaging and data communications services.

25989.name: XMM-NEWTON
25989.description: XMM-Newton is ESA's X-ray Multi-Mirror Mission, one of the most sensitive X-ray telescopes ever built, studying black holes, neutron stars, and galaxy clusters.

25994.name: TERRA
25994.description: Terra is NASA's flagship Earth observing satellite, studying land, oceans, atmosphere, ice, and energy budget with five scientific instruments including MODIS.

26107.name: ASIASTAR
26107.description: ASIASTAR is a commercial communications satellite providing broadcasting and telecommunications services across Asia.

26113.name: IMAGE
26113.description: IMAGE (Imager for Magnetopause-to-Aurora Global Exploration) is a NASA satellite that studies Earth's magnetosphere and aurora phenomena.

26356.name: USA 149 (DSP 20)
26356.description: USA 149 (DSP 20) is a Defense Support Program satellite for early warning of ballistic missile launches and nuclear detonations.

26388.name: TDRS 8
26388.description: TDRS-8 is part of NASA's Tracking and Data Relay Satellite System, providing communication relay services for spacecraft and the International Space Station.

26407.name: NAVSTAR 48 (USA 151)
26407.description: NAVSTAR 48 is a GPS satellite (Block IIR) providing global positioning services with enhanced capabilities and improved signal structure.

26410.name: CLUSTER II-FM7 (SAMBA)
26410.description: CLUSTER II SAMBA is one of four ESA satellites studying Earth's magnetosphere in three dimensions, providing unprecedented insights into space plasma physics.

26463.name: CLUSTER II-FM5 (RUMBA)
26463.description: CLUSTER II RUMBA is part of ESA's four-satellite mission studying the interaction between solar wind and Earth's magnetic field.

26464.name: CLUSTER II-FM8 (TANGO)
26464.description: CLUSTER II TANGO works with three other identical satellites to study Earth's magnetosphere and space weather phenomena.

26554.name: NSS-11
26554.description: NSS-11 is a commercial communications satellite providing broadcasting and telecommunications services.

26575.name: USA 153
26575.description: USA 153 is a classified US military satellite, likely used for reconnaissance and intelligence gathering operations.

26580.name: AMC-6
26580.description: AMC-6 is a commercial communications satellite providing television broadcasting and telecommunications services across North America.

26605.name: NAVSTAR 49 (USA 154)
26605.description: NAVSTAR 49 is a GPS satellite (Block IIR) contributing to the global positioning system constellation with enhanced anti-jamming capabilities.

26702.name: ODIN
26702.description: ODIN is a Swedish-led international satellite studying both astronomy and aeronomy, observing molecular clouds, star formation, and Earth's atmosphere.

26715.name: USA 157 (MILSTAR-2 2)
26715.description: MILSTAR-2 2 is a US military strategic communications satellite providing secure, survivable communications for defense operations worldwide.

26720.name: BSAT-2A
26720.description: BSAT-2A is a Japanese broadcasting satellite providing direct-to-home television services across Japan.

26766.name: INTELSAT 10 (IS-10)
26766.description: INTELSAT 10 is a commercial communications satellite providing global telecommunications and broadcasting services.

26857.name: OMNI-M1
26857.description: OMNI-M1 is a commercial communications satellite providing mobile satellite services.

26880.name: USA 159 (DSP 21)
26880.description: USA 159 (DSP 21) is a Defense Support Program satellite for early warning of ballistic missile launches and nuclear detonations.

26900.name: INTELSAT 902 (IS-902)
26900.description: INTELSAT 902 is a commercial communications satellite providing global telecommunications and broadcasting services.

26931.name: PCSAT (NO-44)
26931.description: PCSAT (Personal Communications Satellite) is an amateur radio satellite built by the US Naval Academy for ham radio communications and educational purposes.

26958.name: PROBA-1
26958.description: PROBA-1 is ESA's first Project for On-Board Autonomy satellite, demonstrating autonomous spacecraft operations and Earth observation technologies.

26998.name: TIMED
26998.description: TIMED (Thermosphere Ionosphere Mesosphere Energetics Dynamics) is a NASA satellite studying the upper atmosphere and its response to solar variability.

27004.name: MAROC-TUBSAT
27004.description: MAROC-TUBSAT is a Moroccan microsatellite built by the Technical University of Berlin for Earth observation and technology demonstration.

27056.name: COSMOS 2385
27056.description: COSMOS 2385 is a Russian GLONASS navigation satellite providing global positioning and timing services as part of Russia's satellite navigation system.

27057.name: COSMOS 2386
27057.description: COSMOS 2386 is a Russian GLONASS navigation satellite contributing to Russia's global positioning and navigation constellation.

27168.name: USA 164 (MILSTAR-2 3)
27168.description: MILSTAR-2 3 is a US military strategic communications satellite providing secure, jam-resistant communications for military operations worldwide.

27380.name: INTELSAT 904 (IS-904)
27380.description: INTELSAT 904 is a commercial communications satellite providing global telecommunications and broadcasting services.

27424.name: AQUA
27424.description: Aqua is NASA's Earth observing satellite focusing on water cycle studies, carrying six instruments including MODIS and AIRS for climate and weather research.

45536.name: SWOT (Surface Water and Ocean Topography)
45536.description: SWOT is a NASA/French/CNES satellite mission designed to provide high-resolution measurements of surface water on Earth, including lakes, rivers, and oceans. Its radar altimeter improves understanding of sea-level rise, coastal hazards, and freshwater resource management.

48058.name: Sentinel-6 Michael Freilich
48058.description: Sentinel-6 Michael Freilich is part of the Copernicus program, providing precise sea surface height measurements to monitor global sea level rise. It continues the legacy of the Jason mission series, delivering critical data for climate change research.

28884.name: Envisat
28884.description: Envisat was an ESA Earth observation satellite that operated for over 10 years providing data on atmosphere, ocean, land, and ice. It contributed extensively to environmental monitoring and climate science before it was decommissioned.

33508.name: Jason-2 (OSTM)
33508.description: Jason-2 was an ocean surface topography satellite continuing the TOPEX/Poseidon mission, measuring sea surface height and ocean circulation changes. It provided essential data for oceanography and climate studies until its decommissioning.

28350.name: TerraSAR-X
28350.description: TerraSAR-X is a German radar Earth observation satellite providing high-resolution imaging regardless of weather conditions, supporting disaster management, mapping, and environmental monitoring.

STARLINK.name: Starlink Constellation
STARLINK.description: Starlink is SpaceX's satellite internet constellation providing high-speed broadband internet worldwide. The constellation consists of thousands of small satellites in low Earth orbit, aiming to deliver low latency and high bandwidth connectivity.

ONEWEB.name: OneWeb Constellation
ONEWEB.description: OneWeb is a LEO satellite internet constellation operated by Eutelsat Group providing global broadband coverage, especially targeting underserved regions with high-speed, low-latency connections.

IRIDIUM.name: Iridium NEXT Constellation
IRIDIUM.description: Iridium NEXT is a constellation of 66 cross-linked satellites in LEO providing truly global voice and data communications, including polar coverage, for commercial and governmental users.

GLOBALSTAR.name: Globalstar Constellation
GLOBALSTAR.description: Globalstar operates a LEO constellation providing satellite phone and low-speed data communications services globally, focusing on remote and rural coverage.

KUIPER.name: Amazon Kuiper Constellation
KUIPER.description: Kuiper is Amazon's planned satellite internet constellation for global broadband connectivity, designed to complement terrestrial networks and foster digital inclusion.

SES_O3b.name: SES O3b Constellation
SES_O3b.description: SES O3b is a medium Earth orbit satellite constellation providing high throughput, low latency broadband services primarily targeted at enterprise, maritime, and remote communications.

CHINA_QIANFAN.name: China Qianfan Constellation
CHINA_QIANFAN.description: Qianfan is a Chinese planned megaconstellation aimed at global broadband internet deployment, leveraging high density low Earth orbit satellites.

CHINA_HONGYU.name: China Hongyu Constellation
CHINA_HONGYU.description: Hongyu is a Chinese satellite constellation focusing on IoT services and broadband across regions with a LEO network.

SPIRE.name: Spire Constellation
SPIRE.description: Spire operates a constellation of nano-satellites providing weather, maritime, and aviation tracking data using radio occultation and AIS signal detection.

SATELIOT.name: Sateliot Constellation
SATELIOT.description: Sateliot is a low Earth orbit satellite constellation dedicated to IoT connectivity, enabling worldwide coverage for IoT devices through small and cost-effective terminals.

SICRAL.name: SICRAL Constellation
SICRAL.description: SICRAL is an Italian military communications satellite system designed to provide secure and resilient SATCOM services to Italian armed forces and allies.

SYRACUSE.name: Syracuse Constellation
SYRACUSE.description: Syracuse is a French military communications satellite constellation providing secure global communications to the French armed forces.

SATCOMBW.name: SATCOMbw Constellation
SATCOMBW.description: SATCOMbw is a German secure communications satellite system offering military-grade SATCOM services and classified communications for defense applications.

SWARM.name: Swarm Technologies Constellation
SWARM.description: Swarm Technologies operates a constellation of CubeSats providing global IoT connectivity, enabling low-cost communication for sensor networks and remote monitoring.

TELESAT_LIGHTSPEED.name: Telesat Lightspeed Constellation
TELESAT_LIGHTSPEED.description: Telesat Lightspeed is a planned LEO satellite constellation focused on delivering secure, global, high-throughput, and low-latency broadband connectivity for enterprise and government clients.
